article:
When I was in Chicago, each morning I left home to catch the 8: 00 bus. One morning I saw an elderly lady at the bus stop with a dog beside her. The bus stopped and we got on.
  _   in eastern countries, only eight passengers were permitted to travel   _  . I
was walking inside the bus  _  the conductor
called, "Only eight standing passengers! The last one who got on, please get
off". I thought it was me who had to get off.  _  , I
saw the elderly lady was about to get off. I told her to stay and got off
instead, but not until I moved past her did I realize she was  _  ! Her companion was her guide dog!
After work I   _  the return journey. What a coincidence! The lady and her dog were
there! I was really  _  as I would get a chance to
speak with her. I started the  _  and she immediately  _  my Asian accent! She asked if I was the  _  person
who helped her that morning.  _  !
Our journey started, and so did her   _  . She told me that her husband had fought in
the Second World War, during which a bomb  took away  his
left leg and that 10% of the government jobs were  _  for
disabled people and  _  was given to the spouses of war veterans  . Because of this they were   _  with her salary and his pension.
Time flew and we arrived at our destination. I helped her cross the road to where an elderly gentleman with a(n )  _    leg was waiting for her. 
It really   _  me
to see how the three of them, helping each other, walked into the distance. But
before we  _  I offered to be there every day to help her get
on the bus. Her husband was very grateful to me as it was a real  _  for
him to walk that far. How good it feels to be needed by others!
